actions.text: Mr. Kolbe raised a point of order against the Sanders amendment (A014). Mr. Kolbe stated that the amendment proposes to change a portion of the bill already passed in the reading. The Chair sustained the point of order.

purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 22 in the Congressional Record of September 9, 1997 to increase funding for the office of the U.S. Trade Representative by $1 million and to reduce funding for general administrative expenses within the Department of Commerce commensurately.
